title: [FEA] Check the max file counter before writing files in `GpuFileFormatDataWriter`

labels.name: task
labels.description: Work required that improves the product but is not user facing

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. I wish the RAPIDS Accelerator for Apache Spark would [...]
This is a follow-up of #6452 

Currently, we check the max file counter during writing the files:
```scala
          withResource(table.contiguousSplit(splitIndexes: _*)) {tabs =>
            tabs.foreach(b => {
              if (needNewWriter) {
                fileCounter += 1
                assert(fileCounter <= MAX_FILE_COUNTER,
                  s"File counter $fileCounter is beyond max value $MAX_FILE_COUNTER")
                newOutputWriter()
              }
```

We could do this checking before the writing, such as:
```scala
val filesNeeded = fileCounter + splitIndexes.length + 1 - (if (needNewWriter) 0 else 1)
assert (fileNeeded <= MAX_FILE_COUNTER)
withResource(table.contiguousSplit(splitIndexes: _*)) {tabs =>
...
```


Also, as the suggestion from @res-life (https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/pull/6801#discussion_r996558720), we should also add tests to check the impact of `MAX_FILE_COUNTER`
